description:
When I reboot the VM via Nova client API, in some cases, the VM state becomes Shutoff while the power state becomes Shutdown.

I tested several times, and the results are weird.

Most of the time the reboot function worked well, but sometimes, the VM state was ACTIVE while the power state was Shutdown; and sometimes, the VM state was Shutoff while the power state was Shutdown.

Anyway, the reboot (whatever soft or hard) was not that stable.
title: unexpected results when reboot a vm

comments.content: What level of code?  What virt driver?  Do you have logs collected?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
2013-09-17 20:03:19.859 WARNING nova.virt.libvirt.driver ... [instance: 30ab48b5-1556-47ff-92ff-77de844f2217] Failed to soft reboot instance.

2013-09-17 20:07:35.405 ERROR nova.compute.manager ... [instance: 28793caa-a6ed-4ef4-a61d-4e7da09cfa55] Cannot reboot instance: [Errno 13] Permission denied: u'/var/lib/nova/instances/28793caa-a6ed-4ef4-a61d-4e7da09cfa55/libvirt.xml'
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~nick-ma-z

comments.content: OK. the problem is solved. the /var/lib/nova/instances/{uuid} directory has the wrong ownership. it's probably not caused by nova compute.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~nick-ma-z
